title: Just Right for My Use Case
description: It is remarkable the divergence of opinion one gets about synthetic oil. Despite the OEM guidance to use 0-20 in my 2007 Toyota Camry, invariably I'll get a mechanic who tries to push me down into a blend or just not use it at all. Who do I give more credence to? Toyota or a ordinary mechanic spouting out their truisms? Well I split the difference by viewing several viscosity test videos. It seemed pretty convincing to me. Synthetic performed best in a range of temperature enviroments.  I am in South Texas so the test thresholds are from Blazin' Hot to Freezin' Cold. Castrol hit the right price point and best reflected what I perceived to be my use case. Not the Oil Filter is another matter. I prefer the high bosch that I had in my Deville but it is not made for the Camry, so I use the next tier below this. My experience with the Bosch filter were seen every time I checked this dipstick. It was remarkable how clean the oil was over time. The maxim (often is but not always) Pay more Get more.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023

title: Great oil & my #1 choice for our Toyota Sequoia V8.
description:
Prices on oil have increased, but this 3-pack was more cost-effective the last time I got oil. I use several favorite brands of oil, but Castrol is 1 that I have alway used with confidence. The Toyota V-8 is a marvelous workhorse of an engine. Changing the oil in my Sequoia takes longer & has more steps than my other vehicles, which is a good reason to use the best product & an oil that seems to do well with extended drain periods. I also have the spare-no-expense mindset on preventing engine wear while getting top protection. Sometimes I will be changing my oil & pondering how much the good oil costs, thinking how some shops would change the oil & filter at half of the cost of doing it myself & save me the time & mess. But, when I do it, I know it is done right, using the correct grade, right amount & high quality product. Drained as long as I choose & not over/under tightened.
All the mental & physical input required for my oil changes motivates me to get the most time & miles on every oil & filter change! With growing wiser, newer recommendations & advanced premium quality lubricants - I choose to change my oil no sooner than 12 months or 5,000 miles. Also, I used the high-mileage & regular mileage versions of this oil & there was no noticeable difference. I prefer the High-Mileage formula since the vehicle is older, with 100K miles+. The reg & high-mileage tend to be around the same price when I shop around.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022
